name: Sourdough Cinnamon Rolls
author: Katy Lenoir
summary: Unfed and long-fermented sourdough starter and buttermilk are used for these cinnamon rolls.
ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more as needed, divided
directions: Mix 3 cups all-purpose flour, buttermilk, sourdough starter, 2 tablespoons cubed butter, and white sugar in a glass bowl
Cover and set in a warm area until double in size, 8 to 12 hours
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Combine baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a small bowl
Knead dough until it is soft but no longer sticky, adding flour as needed
Roll dough with floured rolling pin until it is 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick
Combine 6 tablespoons melted butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon until it has the consistency of a paste
Spread sugar paste evenly on rolled dough
Roll up dough into a cylinder shape
Cut dough into 1/2-inch pieces using dental floss or a serrated knife
Arrange rolls into a cast iron skillet
Bake cinnamon rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes
